Well, from the very beginning, we built Twitter to work over SMS, or simple mobile text messaging.
And so the limit, internationally, for text messages is 160 characters.
So that meant we needed to fit all of our tweets within that limit, but we also needed to reserve room for the name of the author of the tweet.
So we decided to standardize on 140 characters.
And that way, you can read and write tweets in their entirety, on any mobile phone on the planet.
